import six """Trivial DNS driver. This will read/write to either a local, flat file or an in memory BytesIO and have no effect on your actual DNS system. This class is strictly for testing purposes, and should keep you out of dependency hell. A file is used when CONF.log_dir is set. This is relevant for when two different DNS driver instances share the same data file. filename = None if CONF.log_dir: filename = os.path.join(CONF.log_dir, "dnstest.txt") self.file = open(filename, 'w+') else: self.file = six.BytesIO() if not filename or not os.path.exists(filename): self.file.write("# minidns


") self.file.flush() self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if entry and entry['address'] == 'domain': entries.append(entry['name']) self.file.seek(0, os.SEEK_END) self.file.write("%s %s %s
" % (address, self.qualify(name, domain), type)) self.file.flush() keeps = [] self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if (not entry or entry['name'] != self.qualify(name, domain)): keeps.append(line) else: deleted = True self.file.truncate(0) self.file.seek(0) self.file.write(''.join(keeps)) self.file.flush() lines = [] self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if (entry and entry['name'] == self.qualify(name, domain)): lines.append("%s %s %s
" % (address, self.qualify(name, domain), entry['type'])) else: lines.append(line) self.file.truncate(0) self.file.seek(0) self.file.write(''.join(lines)) self.file.flush() self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if entry and entry['address'] == address.lower(): if entry['name'].endswith(domain.lower()): name = entry['name'].split(".")[0] if name not in entries: entries.append(name) self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if (entry and entry['name'] == self.qualify(name, domain)): entries.append(entry['address']) self.file.close() try: if os.path.exists(self.file.name): try: os.remove(self.file.name) except OSError: pass except AttributeError: # This was a BytesIO, which has no name. pass self.file.seek(0, os.SEEK_END) self.file.write("%s %s %s
" % ('domain', fqdomain, 'domain')) self.file.flush() keeps = [] self.file.seek(0) for line in self.file: entry = self.parse_line(line) if (not entry or entry['domain'] != fqdomain.lower()): keeps.append(line) else: LOG.info(_LI("deleted %s"), entry) deleted = True self.file.truncate(0) self.file.seek(0) self.file.write(''.join(keeps)) self.file.flush()

subject: Set a var for the MariaDB major version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-14 20:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client/commit/53c4e101febee94c0eea055a28c3115bec1d51a6', 'message': 'Set a var for the MariaDB major version

Setting a custom MariaDB mirror URL is very tedious to maintain
because operators must ensure they update the overridden repo
URL every time the major version changes within the galera role.

This will allow operators to set overrides for their local mirror
like:

galera_client_repo_url: "http://mirror.mydomain.com/mariadb/repo/{{ galera_major_version }}/ubuntu"

Change-Id: Ic6a11da9994c5f4bddeb392cbad7e40400c5c117
'}]
commit_message:
Set a var for the MariaDB major version

Setting a custom MariaDB mirror URL is very tedious to maintain
because operators must ensure they update the overridden repo
URL every time the major version changes within the galera role.

This will allow operators to set overrides for their local mirror
like:

galera_client_repo_url: "http://mirror.mydomain.com/mariadb/repo/{{ galera_major_version }}/ubuntu"

Change-Id: Ic6a11da9994c5f4bddeb392cbad7e40400c5c117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/20/504220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message.

Change-Id: I794df693282cb9016dbe3825e0f1aa1254e6efdd
Closes-Bug: #1717144
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-cookiecutter refs/changes/70/504770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to undef. # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $revocation_cache_time = $::os_service_default, if $revocation_cache_time { warning('revocation_cache_time parameter is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in the future.') }

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-20 21:02:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/1898f58e6ed9ad6b4b9b0219dec52c93667a65a2', 'message': "Fix pacemaker remote 'Illegal relationship operand..' errors

Trying to use a pacemaker remote manifest breaks like this:

Closes-Bug: #1718534

Change-Id: I0b1a5821226491a453b816e3b09369dc4b60d31b

commit_message:
Fix pacemaker remote 'Illegal relationship operand..' errors

Trying to use a pacemaker remote manifest breaks like this:

Error: Evaluation Error: Illegal relationship operand, can not form a
relationship with an Undef Value. A Catalog type is required. at
/etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/manifests/remote.pp:31:6 on node

The reason is that the change introduced in
I9511c1830b967038721e03dcbb4401cc3059648a broke the pacemaker remote
functionality.

Let's switch to resource collectors to fix these relationship
issues so we still get the ordering right without the issue:
Debug: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Remote/Package[pacemaker-remote]/before: subscribes to File[etc-pacemaker]

Closes-Bug: #1718534

Change-Id: I0b1a5821226491a453b816e3b09369dc4b60d31b

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: Ie4e84d00ba741c394eaca459e4e1d7beca5375f4
Closes-Bug: #1717144
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/99/503899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to undef # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $revocation_cache_time = undef, if $revocation_cache_time { warning('revocation_cache_time parameter is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in the future.') }
deleted_lines: # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $revocation_cache_time = $::os_service_default, revocation_cache_time => $revocation_cache_time,

subject: Use @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock to retry scheduler transactions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-20 16:48:27.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/services/scheduler.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_subworkflows_pause_resume.py', 'mistral/db/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/aeba4ea68d4e0b9be0a3b4289fb19e0e1e4acda3', 'message': "Use @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock to retry scheduler transactions

* Since scheduler has transactional logic we need to account for
  cases when these transactions hit DB deadlocks. It is possible
  just due to MySQL nature, it's recommended to always design
  based on that. This patch decomposes one big scheduler method
  that processes delayed calls into smaller methods so that we
  could apply @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock decorator to repeat
  transactions if they fail because of a deadlock in MySQL.
* Fixed taskk state update when we're assiging it to RUNNING.
  In this case we can't set it to RUNNING if there any paused
  child executions.
* Fixed the test for cascaded pausing which didn't account
  non-atomicity of this operation

Closes-Bug: #1715589
Change-Id: Iffa0fb540a5705c587d71d30af6ab913b26d3952
(cherry picked from commit a995916f14a7490602bea53d1e3b3c9dc15ffa18)

commit_message:
Use @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock to retry scheduler transactions

* Since scheduler has transactional logic we need to account for
  cases when these transactions hit DB deadlocks. It is possible
  just due to MySQL nature, it's recommended to always design
  based on that. This patch decomposes one big scheduler method
  that processes delayed calls into smaller methods so that we
  could apply @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock decorator to repeat
  transactions if they fail because of a deadlock in MySQL.
* Fixed taskk state update when we're assiging it to RUNNING.
  In this case we can't set it to RUNNING if there any paused
  child executions.
* Fixed the test for cascaded pausing which didn't account
  non-atomicity of this operation

Closes-Bug: #1715589
Change-Id: Iffa0fb540a5705c587d71d30af6ab913b26d3952
(cherry picked from commit a995916f14a7490602bea53d1e3b3c9dc15ffa18)

commit_message:
Disable vitrage in scenario001

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504917/ has introduced support
to database backend which requires some additional configuration
not included in puppet-vitrage

Until this is fixed in puppet-vitrage, let's disable it to unblock
promotions in puppet pipeline.

Change-Id: I82fb33cc37b49bea909682390f1c87681fc8bff1
Related-Bug: #1718484

remove priority 30 from testing repos

with default one (99) as all other repos.

commit_message:
Remove deploy_steps_tasks.yaml from upgrade_steps_playbook

After landing https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503484/ we run the
puppet host configuration steps twice. This change removes the
deploy_steps_tasks.yaml playbook in order to run the puppet steps
only once.

Closes-bug: 1717244
Change-Id: I09461094618124915841c8390c8bce8daf64d029

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: I2c340522a696c3e436404e1b1403d6cf072d56d3
Closes-Bug: #1717144

added_lines: # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to undef # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $revocation_cache_time = undef, if $revocation_cache_time { warning('revocation_cache_time parameter is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in the future.') }

commit_message:
Raise castellan minimum to 0.14.0

Commit 8980bf7da55dd084ad84c84534fe937f0d43b9c0 in Castellan deprecated
config option key_manager.api_class, switching to use key_manager.backend.

In order for consumers to switch to using backend, we need to ensure the
version of castellan used is at least 0.13.0 to have this option present.
There were some known issues with 0.13.0, so jumping up to the 0.14.0
release.

This is causing at least Cinder docs builds to fail due to treating
warnings as errors and getting deprecation warnings during the build.

Related-bug: #1718468
Change-Id: I112f7a4654a65c3291526b408838d7b1c175b069
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/11/505711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix device_owner during DVR and HA migrations

When HA router is migrated to DVR, router's
DEVICE_OWNER_HA_REPLICATED_INT interface has to be updated
to DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE.

Similarly for DVR to HA migration, DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE
has to be updated to DEVICE_OWNER_HA_REPLICATED_INT.

Also, for Legacy to HA migration, DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF
has to be updated to DEVICE_OWNER_HA_REPLICATED_INT.

Also added unit test cases for all possible migration cases.

Closes-Bug: 1714796
Change-Id: I23642b3f5fe8411d0c8c526750f6965caa71fc2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/500379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_owner=const.DEVICE_OWNER_HA_REPLICATED_INT, new_owner=const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE) self.l3plugin._migrate_router_ports( context, router_db, if router.get('ha'): new_owner = const.DEVICE_OWNER_HA_REPLICATED_INT else: new_owner = const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF new_owner=new_owner)

commit_message:
Fix Openstack.dummy plugin implementation

It should have default context "users@openstack"
as every OpenStack Plugin has, otherwise you can't
use OpenStack context

This blocks next patch

Change-Id: I4e50d30c964e794906ccc0d3543f74b8492477a4

commit_message:
Clean up deprecated items in the inspection code

* Remove support for setting IPMI credentials (removed from inspector in Pike)
* Stop sending the ipmi_address field (bmc_address is used instead since Pike)

Change-Id: I1696041db62ba27e5d31e8481cb225a43d7e2a46
Closes-Bug: #1654318
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/94/505194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Support for setting IPMI credentials during inspection was removed. This feature is not supported by ironic-inspector since the Pike release. - | The ``ipmi_address`` field is no longer sent as part of the inspection process. The ``inventory[bmc_address]`` field should be used instead.

subject: Drop pycrypto from utility genpwd.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-18 20:50:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/4c80aede688f3f2311e1986133eb16e0e7ebbb54', 'message': 'Drop pycrypto from utility genpwd.py

pycrypto is unmaintained for a while and requirements team advises using
pycryptodome or cryptography libraries instead (see openstack-dev thread
[0]).

genpwd.py uses pycrypto to generate RSA keypair. This commit rewrite
generate_RSA function using python-cryptography while keeping strict 1:1
compatibility with previous code.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html

Change-Id: I13f468c35adb7b2cf76b3d04d9d700aa8ea54a85
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-18 21:56:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/38f25b8330be497f69bc23c2bfc5bfb0910da972', 'message': 'Drop pycrypto from utility genpwd.py

pycrypto is unmaintained for a while and requirements team advises using
pycryptodome or cryptography libraries instead (see openstack-dev thread
[0]).

genpwd.py uses pycrypto to generate RSA keypair. This commit rewrite

commit_message:
Drop pycrypto from utility genpwd.py

pycrypto is unmaintained for a while and requirements team advises using
pycryptodome or cryptography libraries instead (see openstack-dev thread
[0]).

genpwd.py uses pycrypto to generate RSA keypair. This commit rewrite
generate_RSA function using python-cryptography while keeping strict 1:1
compatibility with previous code.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html

Change-Id: I13f468c35adb7b2cf76b3d04d9d700aa8ea54a85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/46/484946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric import rsa from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization import (Encoding, NoEncryption, PrivateFormat, PublicFormat) # public_exponent set to 655537 is what pyCA recommends new_key = rsa.generate_private_key(public_exponent=65537, key_size=bits, backend=default_backend()) # we strip trailing space for 1:1 compat with previous pycrypto implementation private_key = new_key.private_bytes(encoding=Encoding.PEM, format=PrivateFormat.TraditionalOpenSSL, encryption_algorithm=NoEncryption()).strip() public_key = new_key.public_key().public_bytes(encoding=Encoding.OpenSSH, format=PublicFormat.OpenSSH)
deleted_lines: from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA new_key = RSA.generate(bits, os.urandom) private_key = new_key.exportKey("PEM") public_key = new_key.publickey().exportKey("OpenSSH")

commit_message:
Log deprecation warning for allow_versions

...with the hope of removing support for the option in the future.
We'll forever need to watch for X-Versions-Location in on-disk
data, though.

Change-Id: I19c4c66102aa96df393a642dbcf984f77aa3f25a
Related-Change: Ie899290b3312e201979eafefb253d1a60b65b837

commit_message:
Squash dacnet_admin privsep context.

As discussed at the PTG, we're going to use one big context for
ease of management.

commit_message:
Add nova-manage db command for ironic flavor migrations

This adds `nova-manage db ironic_flavor_migration` which allows
pushing the migrations ahead of time, and without ironic or nova
services running.

This is a similar operation to online_data_migrations, but there is
a need to pass data that would normally be retrieved from ironic.
However, we want this to work offline and thus that data must be
provided locally. When fast-forwarding through the pike release,
ironic and nova-compute will never be started and thus we can't rely
on the online nature of the migration integrated into the ironic
driver.

Change-Id: I459bce472227ee08230d3120d9e2eb1bde635218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/501025/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.virt import ironic @args('--host', metavar='<host>', help='Compute service name to migrate nodes on') @args('--node', metavar='<node>', help='Ironic node to migrate (all on the host if omitted)') @args('--resource_class', metavar='<class>', help='Ironic node class to set on instances') @args('--all', action='store_true', default=False, help='Run migrations for all ironic hosts and nodes') def ironic_flavor_migration(self, host, node, resource_class, all_hosts): """Migrate flavor information for ironic instances. This will manually push the instance flavor migration required for ironic-hosted instances in Pike. The best way to accomplish this migration is to run your ironic computes normally in Pike. However, if you need to push the migration manually, then use this. This is idempotent, but not trivial to start/stop/resume. It is recommended that you do this with care and not from a script assuming it is trivial. Running with --all may generate a large amount of DB traffic all at once. Running at least one host at a time is recommended for batching. Return values: 0: All work is completed (or none is needed) 1: Specified host and/or node is not found, or no ironic nodes present 2: Internal accounting error shows more than one instance per node 3: Invalid combination of required arguments """ ctx = context.get_admin_context() if all_hosts: cns = objects.ComputeNodeList.get_by_hypervisor(ctx, 'ironic') if host or node: print(_('--all with --host and/or --node does not make sense')) return 3 elif host and node: try: cn = objects.ComputeNode.get_by_host_and_nodename(ctx, host, node) cns = [cn] except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: cns = [] elif host: try: cns = objects.ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(ctx, host) except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: cns = [] else: print(_('Either --all, --host, or --host and --node are required')) return 3 if len(cns) == 0: print(_('No ironic compute nodes found that match criteria')) return 1 # Check that we at least got one ironic compute and we can pretty # safely assume the rest are if cns[0].hypervisor_type != 'ironic': print(_('Compute node(s) specified is not of type ironic')) return 1 for cn in cns: inst = objects.InstanceList.get_by_filters( ctx, {'node': cn.hypervisor_hostname}) if len(inst) > 1: print(_('Ironic node has two instances? Something is wrong.')) return 2 ironic.IronicDriver._pike_flavor_migration_for_node(ctx, resource_class, inst[0].uuid) return 0

commit_message:
Add ComputeNodeList.get_by_hypervisor_type()

This lets us pull ComputeNode objects from the DB by hypervisor type.
Note that this is not remotable, so no version bump needed until/unless
we make it so.

Change-Id: I36f7b3386510a64df77b61409f3b4e6530ed3f90

Partial-Bug: #1715759

commit_message:
Implement metadata for backup create/update

We have a gap in the micro versions implemented in the cinderclient
and the MAX version being reported by the client.

This patch addresses the missing changes for micro version 3.43
which adds support for metadata for backup create and update.

Change-Id: I14c7205784c53ec3ab0985a4460a88f59de171fb
Partial-Bug: #1715759
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/02/501902/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @api_versions.wraps("3.9", "3.43") # NOTE(jdg): Placing 3.43 in versions.wraps above for clarity, # but it's irrelevant as this just uses the kwargs, should we # remove that? @api_versions.wraps("3.43") def create(self, volume_id, container=None, name=None, description=None, incremental=False, force=False, snapshot_id=None, metadata=None): """Creates a volume backup. :param volume_id: The ID of the volume to backup. :param container: The name of the backup service container. :param name: The name of the backup. :param description: The description of the backup. :param incremental: Incremental backup. :param force: If True, allows an in-use volume to be backed up. :param metadata: Key Value pairs :rtype: :class:`VolumeBackup` """ body = {'backup': {'volume_id': volume_id, 'container': container, 'name': name, 'description': description, 'incremental': incremental, 'force': force, 'snapshot_id': snapshot_id, 'metadata': metadata, }} return self._create('/backups', body, 'backup')

commit_message:
xenapi: Exception Error logs shown in Citrix XenServer CI

There are many errors in the patchs which passed our XenServer CI,
it is because when run tempest, test case will ask nova sevice to
do snapshotting, then delete image before snapshotting done. Then
nova compute service couldn't find the image when do image upload
and raise an exception.
Normally the exception can be consumed by nova service. But the
exception generated by os-xenapi can't be recognized by nova, so
the error logs come out.
Add a exception which computer service can process.
Modify vmops.py to transfer exception to Nova compute.
Add unit test for exception transfer

Change-Id: I49f1a2aab507cc4b1c4a3d6c13df96ee3e678a99
Depends-On: I16d199e93f615e4f374d49948dceeb4d1d600aa9
Depends-On: I80007bb897a1f7eda47ebda82e08fe270f97ff40
Closes-Bug: 1700926

added_lines: try: self.image_upload_handler.upload_image(context, self._session, instance, image_id, vdi_uuids, ) except self._session.XenAPI.Failure as exc: LOG.debug("get exception from xenapi plugin %s", exc) details = exc.details if (len(exc.details) == 4 and details[3] == 'ImageNotFound'): LOG.debug("raise ImageNotFound exception") raise exception.ImageNotFound(image_id=image_id)

commit_message:
Squash dac_admin privsep context.

As discussed at the PTG, squash the dac_admin privsep context into
the sysadmin context.

Change-Id: I10142be4baa404835fabebd50f7f976ca6ec402e
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
Move the dac_admin privsep code to a new location.

Having utilities that are named after the context they use that no
longer exists is going to be super confusing later. Move these to
a better place.

Change-Id: Id203aa6c02c3b486f63151b3607e928990a6ca7b
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
remove node-id, node_idx and part instance vars in _one_shard_cycle

replace with local vars not hanging off self

also replace sharder.roundrobindatadirs with inline search for
matching node

Change-Id: If668408feb61c17cfb81960db01e809e49144120

commit_message:
XenAPI: Bump minimum os-xenapi to 0.3.1

In 0.3.x, it contains several bug fixes and also supports some new
features: e.g. xapi pool, vdi streaming.
This is to switch os-xenapi to the latest os-xenapi 0.3.1.

Change-Id: I80007bb897a1f7eda47ebda82e08fe270f97ff40

added_lines: function odl_artifcat_id { local ODL_DIR=$1 local ODL_URL_PREFIX=$2 local BUNDLEVERSION=$3 local OFFLINE=$4 local MAVENMETAFILE=$ODL_DIR/maven-metadata-artifact-id.xml local _NEXUSPATH _NEXUSPATH=$(_odl_nexus_path $ODL_URL_PREFIX) _wget $MAVENMETAFILE ${_NEXUSPATH}/${BUNDLEVERSION}/maven-metadata.xml $OFFLINE if [[ -f "$MAVENMETAFILE" ]]; then # In auto release case, metadata file exists only in parent directly. # e.g. https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/autorelease-1929/org/opendaylight/integration/distribution-karaf/maven-metadata.xml _wget $MAVENMETAFILE ${_NEXUSPATH}/maven-metadata.xml $OFFLINE fi local result result=$(_xpath "//artifactId/text()" $MAVENMETAFILE) echo $result } local _NEXUSPATH _NEXUSPATH=$(_odl_nexus_path $ODL_URL_PREFIX) _wget $MAVENMETAFILE ${_NEXUSPATH}/maven-metadata.xml $OFFLINE echo "$MAVENMETAFILE doesn't exist. Please try with OFFLINE=False and check internet connection to $_NEXUSPATH" local _NEXUSPATH _NEXUSPATH=$(_odl_nexus_path $ODL_URL_PREFIX) _wget $MAVENMETAFILE ${_NEXUSPATH}/${BUNDLEVERSION}/maven-metadata.xml $OFFLINE export ODL_URL=${_NEXUSPATH}/${BUNDLEVERSION} export ODL_PKG=${ODL_ARTIFACT_ID}-${BUNDLE_TIMESTAMP}.zip local _NEXUSPATH="${NEXUSPATH:-${ODL_URL_PREFIX}/${ODL_URL_RELEASE_REPOSITORY_PATH}/${ODL_URL_DISTRIBUTION_KARAF_PATH}}" export ODL_URL=${_NEXUSPATH}/${BUNDLEVERSION} export ODL_PKG=${ODL_ARTIFACT_ID}-${BUNDLEVERSION}.zip

commit_message:
For OVB, use correct InternalApiNetCidr

OVB creates an internal_api subnet with cidr 172.17.0.0/24, however
the following tripleo-quickstart-extras config files specify
172.20.0.0/24

This change fixes the ovb configs to use 172.17.0.0/24.

Change-Id: Ib1a4c4988cb590576ceebe8bb7cd23381f7cfaa0
Closes-Bug: #1709768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/79/493379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: Id17d4e5c6079fffe04372fe0d1d86c7e2267f7c0
Closes-Bug: #1717144
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/30/503930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to undef # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $revocation_cache_time = undef, #NOTE(emilien): Use pick to keep backward compatibility $username_real = pick($::sahara::admin_user,$username) $password_real = pick($::sahara::admin_password,$password) $project_name_real = pick($::sahara::admin_tenant_name,$project_name) $memcached_servers_real = pick($::sahara::memcached_servers,$memcached_servers) $auth_uri_real = pick($::sahara::auth_uri,$auth_uri) $auth_url_real = pick($::sahara::identity_uri,$auth_url) if $revocation_cache_time { warning('revocation_cache_time parameter is deprecated, has no effect and will be removed in the future.') }
deleted_lines: # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $revocation_cache_time = $::os_service_default,#NOTE(emilien): Use pick to keep backward compatibility $username_real = pick($::sahara::admin_user,$username) $password_real = pick($::sahara::admin_password,$password) $project_name_real = pick($::sahara::admin_tenant_name,$project_name) $memcached_servers_real = pick($::sahara::memcached_servers,$memcached_servers) $auth_uri_real = pick($::sahara::auth_uri,$auth_uri) $auth_url_real = pick($::sahara::identity_uri,$auth_url) revocation_cache_time => $revocation_cache_time,

commit_message:
Add pypy project-templates

Add a non-voting one to match current behavior (we'll map current use of
pypy-jobs to the non-voting template) but add a new one since pypy
actually does work now so people can switch from nonvoting to voting.

Change-Id: I34a82e675624279f3fddd635a6c95ece02cdb975
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/16/504116/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: openstack-tox-pypy parent: openstack-tox description: | Run unit tests for an OpenStack Python project under PyPy. Uses tox with the ``pypy`` environment. irrelevant-files: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.*$ - ^releasenotes/.*$ vars: tox_envlist: py27 - job: name: openstack-pypy-jobs check: jobs: - openstack-tox-py35: # BUG #1290562 pypy does not work with new setuptools, so is # breaking all jobs. Disable until there is resolution. voting: false - project-template:

commit_message:
Zun ut should use it's own serialize namespace.

The serialize namespace in zun using the 'versioned_object',
according to versioned object project doc, sub-class should use
it's own serialize namespace.

Add 'zun_object' serialize namespace to objects/base. Change the
corresponding ut.

Change-Id: Ie448202a5cb29b8be7dea76ae820e549174dfc17
Closes-Bug: #1718329

commit_message:
Add mapping file setting to skip jobs from share queues

We calculate shared queues from jobs using a job with the same name.
However, there are some jobs, such as the noop job, that might imply a
shared queue where one is not desired.

Change-Id: I89d0ea8b5fbd6c07ed54744db99e9ccacca532fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/66/504966/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Add xstatic-check-version and openstack-tox-pypy

We're mapping pypy-jobs to openstack-pypy-jobs-nonvoting because the
current behavior is non-voting.

subject: Set right endpoint IP in ssh tunnel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-19 07:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/ssh-tunnel.service.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/d146beeb918b42b61c6bc5ef51bf85ad4eda7e7a', 'message': 'Set right endpoint IP in ssh tunnel

Depending on the TripleO configuration, the endpoints can be deployed
with tls or without it. The public endpoint IP will defer depending on this
setting, therefor it should be taken into account when assigning the
ssh tunnel IP. Otherwise traffic is not correctly tunnel when TripleO is

Change-Id: I0f312f78a87182116e0c4b274ed145f3f08c8197

commit_message:
Set right endpoint IP in ssh tunnel

Depending on the TripleO configuration, the endpoints can be deployed
with tls or without it. The public endpoint IP will defer depending on this
setting, therefor it should be taken into account when assigning the
ssh tunnel IP. Otherwise traffic is not correctly tunnel when TripleO is
deployed with tls (undercloud_generate_service_certificate = true)

Change-Id: I0f312f78a87182116e0c4b274ed145f3f08c8197
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/74/485074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% set ssh_tunnel_target_ip = "https://%s" % undercloud_network_cidr|nthhost(2) if undercloud_generate_service_certificate|bool else "http://%s:3000" % undercloud_network_cidr|nthhost(1) %}

commit_message:
Handle latest changes to os-testr

With the latests changes to os-testr[0] it now expects
a .stestr.conf file instead of a .testr.conf file.

This change migrates the .testr.conf to .stestr.conf and
adds the new .stestr directory to .gitignore while removing
the old .testr.conf and .testrepository from .gitignore.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html

Change-Id: I8fd29dbd033b4ea27c7cc85c9981a7f10f675cd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/07/503807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I628f5a1463a893bfc16f795ef7144cd2376130de
Closes-Bug: #1519510

Add specs publication jobs

We need to publish specs differently than docs.

Change-Id: I54cded42086b2b3b39738cb8dc402e110d9eea6a

commit_message:
Use @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock to retry scheduler transactions

* Since scheduler has transactional logic we need to account for
  cases when these transactions hit DB deadlocks. It is possible
  just due to MySQL nature, it's recommended to always design
  based on that. This patch decomposes one big scheduler method
  that processes delayed calls into smaller methods so that we
  could apply @db_utils.retry_on_deadlock decorator to repeat
  transactions if they fail because of a deadlock in MySQL.
* Fixed taskk state update when we're assiging it to RUNNING.
  In this case we can't set it to RUNNING if there any paused
  child executions.
* Fixed the test for cascaded pausing which didn't account
  non-atomicity of this operation

Closes-Bug: #1715589
Change-Id: Iffa0fb540a5705c587d71d30af6ab913b26d3952
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/57/501657/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message.

Change-Id: Iec28b6bf0d11f723924833d35791153dbce92ed7
Closes-Bug: #1717144
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-cookiecutter refs/changes/48/504348/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $revocation_cache_time = $::os_service_default, revocation_cache_time => $revocation_cache_time,
